A Balanced Program 


     I do not believe it is right to devote so much attention to the sale of the smaller books, to the neglect of the larger ones. It is wrong to leave lying on the shelves the large works that the Lord has revealed should be put into the hands of the people, and to push so vigorously, in the place of these, the sale of small books. Ms 123, 1902, p. 10. (From a report of a Council meeting held at Elmshaven, October 19, 1902.)
